visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: 'Symmetrical Distribution', Axes and labels styling: X-axis title: 'Sepal Width (cm)', Y-axis title: '', Labels and titles should have a font size of 9px and color rgba(0,0,0,.9), Data series: The data should be binned from the rawData array, with the series name 'Distribution', Custom colors: Use the custom color palette defined in the JavaScript code, Additional configurations: Disable legend, credits, and exporting, and set the chart margins to [60, 10, 40, 40].
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration object is designed to render a column chart with specific styling and data presentation. The chart type is set to 'column', and the title is 'Symmetrical Distribution' with a subtitle indicating the source of the data. The X-axis is labeled 'Sepal Width (cm)', and the Y-axis has no title. The labels and titles are styled with a font size of 9px and a color of rgba(0,0,0,.9). The data series is derived from the rawData array, which is binned into intervals, and the series is named 'Distribution'. The chart uses a custom color palette, with the first color in the palette applied to the columns. Additional configurations disable the legend, credits, and exporting features, and set the chart margins to [60, 10, 40, 40]. The plot options for the series include padding adjustments and border settings to ensure a clean and compact presentation of the data.
